reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Amed is certainly an underwhelming place to visit unless you are a die hard snorkeler/diver. The restaurants all serve identical menu items and the food quality and preparation are poor as relates to the rest of the island. Santai has nice grounds and they try hard yet the room had maintainence issues that were brought to Managements attention and not repaired over a 4 night stay. Normally Balinese service is excellent and attentive yet the general malaise from all the staff was ever present. They seemed tired and bored with a heavy dose of indifference. We paid $us80 from the internet and arrived to lower offered rates and when we tried to check out early were told not possible and they would bill our CC. We did agree to cancellation policy fine print! You can get much better for much less if you have to visit.
reviews.title: mediocre Santai experience

reviews.text: Stayed for a week with the family, two grown-ups and two kids (1½ and 3 years old), as a first stop on a months stay on Bali. Very nice hotel with lush gardens just next to the beach. Bungalows (63 US$ per night incl breakfast, not seaside) on the small side for the four of us although there is a loft which we could have used if the kids had been a bit older. All in all not ideal for small kids, but the pool worked well and the beach was very convenient for playing with toys in the sand and evening walks before dinner.
reviews.title: Quiet place on the beach (in Amed)
